citation.article-title: Oceanibaculum indicum gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from deep seawater of the Indian Ocean
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Oceanibaculum (O.ce.a′ni.ba′cu.lum. Gr. n. oceanus ocean; L. neut. n. baculum stick; N.L. neut. n. Oceanibaculum rod-shaped bacterium from the ocean).
Cells are rod shaped, motile by means of a single polar flagellum, Gram-negative, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, capable of reducing nitrate to nitrite, but not capable of denitrification.
The dominant fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 1 2-OH and C19 : 0ω8c cyclo.
The type species is Oceanibaculum indicum.
